title: Cayley's sextic
summary: In geometry, Cayley's sextic (sextic of Cayley, Cayley's sextet) is a plane curve, a member of the sinusoidal spiral family, first discussed by Colin Maclaurin in 1718.  Arthur Cayley was the first to study the curve in detail and it was named after him in 1900 by Raymond Clare Archibald.
